Row.Text: The Conquistador is a multi-purpose unit that is strong both on land and at sea. Replacing the Knight, it is an exceptional scout on land with extra visibility. It also has the ability to found new cities, but only on a foreign continent that does not contain the Castilian capital. When founded, cities built by Conquistadors start with 3 Citizens, claim additional territory, and automatically receive the following selection of buildings:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Council[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Granary[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Market[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Monument[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Shrine[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Barracks[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Watermill (if applicable)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Library[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Forge[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Well (if applicable)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Mission (Castle)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Note: the bonuses for constructing buildings from the Progress and Industry policy branches do apply to the buildings constructed by Pioneers, so expect a large boost to your culture or income when you settle new lands with this unit![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In the water, the Conquistador has the defensive embarkation promotion that allows it to defend itself against naval units. It also suffers no penalty when attacking cities, unlike the Knight.
Conquering cities of a foreign religion awards [ICON_PEACE] Faith and [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Conquered cities begin with your State Religion and cannot lose this religion whilst under your control.

Early Mounted Unit that is deadliest when flanking. Restores Hit Points and 2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement after capturing a city following a different State Religion, and attacks cities more effectively. Only Castile may build it.

The Jinete is the unique Horseman for Castile. The Jinete, unlike the Horseman, receives a smaller penalty when attacking cities and restores Hit Points and Movement whenever it captures a city following a different State Religion. They are also more effective at performing flank attacks.
